message.content: This question requires knowledge of the concept of pollution and its effects on the environment. Adding something poisonous to an environment and causing harm is commonly referred to as dirtying or polluting the environment. Option (B) is incorrect because "liking" has no relation to pollution. Option (C), cleaning, is the opposite action of polluting and does not describe the harmful act. Option (D), observing, is an unrelated action and not connected to the concept of pollution.

This question tests our understanding of environmental impact and the concept of adding something harmful to an environment. When we add something poisonous to an environment and it causes harm, it is generally referred to as dirtying or polluting the environment. Option (B) is incorrect because liking something does not imply harm or negative impact. Option (C) is incorrect because cleaning refers to removing dirt or pollutants, not adding them. Option (D) is incorrect because observing refers to simply watching or studying the environment, without any direct action of adding something harmful.

This question requires knowledge of vocabulary and concepts related to environmental health. Adding something poisonous to an environment and harming it is commonly referred to as "dirtying" or polluting the environment. Option (B) is incorrect because "liking" has no connection to causing harm to the environment. Option (C) is incorrect because "cleaning" refers to the removal of dirt, pollutants, or harmful substances, and does not involve adding something poisonous. Option (D) is incorrect because "observing" refers to the act of watching or studying something, and does not involve causing harm to the environment.
